subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] On PALM
msgSnippet: John Cowan  wrote:                               The PALM lexical set is pretty small, I should probably explain. It consists of words written
messageBody:
John Cowan <cowan@...> wrote:
The PALM lexical set is pretty small, I should probably explain.
It consists of words written "al" where the "l" is no longer
pronounced, as in "palm" itself...

Speak for yourself.  In my dialect the "l" in palm, psalm, calm, balm, etc., is pronounced.  :-)

With all these complexities regarding QS, it's a miracle we all ever learn to communicate with each other in the first place!

Ron Cameron

John Cowan <cowan@...> wrote:                               The PALM lexical set is pretty small, I should probably explain.
 It consists of words written "al" where the "l" is no longer
 pronounced, as in "palm" itself...




Speak for yourself.  In my dialect the "l" in palm, psalm, calm, balm, etc., is pronounced.  :-)

With all these complexities regarding QS, it's a miracle we all ever learn to communicate with each other in the first place!

Ron Cameron
